Posts.Content: Hi After surgery, rads and now Tamoxifen and Zoladex for pre menopause oestrogen positive cancer, I'm starting work again this week. I'm so low though, I've got terrible insomnia from the Tamoxifen. I feel like I don't want to go back yet. My GP says it's time to try. But, right going to be so honest here. My life before cancer was not too wonderful.  I went to work to pay the bills, I'm married but my marriage doesn't make me happy. So before cancer I was going through the motions, existing but not living.  Now going back to work seems like I'm stepping back into my sad little life without being able to wave a magic wand and dream of a new start. It's like I'm going back to all the conditions that added to my diagnosis. Years of unhappiness. I even feel life isn't worth this. I should be feeling I'm lucky surely? I'm so down. I thought about just disappearing so ironic after fighting to survive for so long.
Posts.Title: Starting again but so low

Posts.Content: I don't know how to reply to everyone in one go, so am posting this.  I cannot thank you all enough for your brilliant, helpful and considerate replies. You are quite amazing you know! You restore my faith in everything. I really do think my medication especially the Tamoxifen seems to be making me into a different person. I am phoning the doctor TODAY. I need some help at the moment and yes I have troubles at home, life is like that, but with the Tamoxifen I have been feeling so low. Scarily so. I will seek help right now. You don't realise how much each and every reply has helped me. You've made me sit up and tackle this.  THANK YOU ALL OF YOU
Posts.Title: Starting again but so low

Posts.Content: Dearest London lass You are incredible you know. Your help and support is quite simply like an angels. I am so grateful for your incredible reply.  Thank you so very much. I honestly am overwhelmed by your support and advice.  Xxxxcxc

Posts.Content: That is fantastic. THANK YOU. I love it. Xxxxxx

Posts.Content: Thank you. Yes small steps now. One day at a time. Xxxx

I've also noticed a few things you've mentioned, but my mood is getting better. I'm seeing my Oncofist Tuesday and will ask her about this. I'm so glad you've replied and voiced this. Good luck to you too and I really appreciate your reply.
Posts.Title: Starting again but so low

Posts.Content: Thank you. Been given Sertraline. It should help my mood. Never in all my years have i ever taken drugs before. But I'm having too. Hopefully they will calm the Tamoxifen mood.
Posts.Title: Starting again but so low

Posts.Content: Thank you Debs. You, Carolyn and everyone who replied in such detail and with helpful links ( I'm still reading those - so helpful), people sharing their own reasons and giving such help, overwhelming really. Really blown away by just how fabulous our gang of brilliant people are.  You are all fabulous. Xxxx if I knew how to insert a picture, I would!
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype Result Advice please - part two THANKS EVERYONE

Posts.Content: Dear lovely, beautiful, kind and thoughtful ladies for all your fantastic responses. I have read every one fully and made a lot o sense from them all. This is the hardest life decision I have been asked to make, still am undecided, but have to really know that whatever it is, I have to be comfortable with it forever.I am so overwhelmed by the time and effort you have spent in helping me, I honestly think you should all get a huge hug because you are giving time and effort to someone else's dilemma whilst facing/having faced your own things.You make me proud to be part of you all. I wish everyone all the very best. I shall definitely be posting again, and asking for more help, I am sure. If I can help you too, I will. Hugs, kindness and happiness.xxxxx.
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype Result Advice please - part two THANKS EVERYONE

Posts.Content: Lots of really fab replies. I can certainly understand. On my journey I have found friends who have shone, people you wouldn't expect and I've had to make a few emotional decisions about those who have not got in touch or one who said to me, well if your not having chemo your not that ill. People are sadly ignorant. You will shine with the good stars out there.   Hugs xxx Pootle
Posts.Title: Really bloody angry !!!

Posts.Content: Hi I've been very happy healing from surgery a therapeutic mammoplasty plus left side WLE and SLB in mid February. Had a check up and had clear margins. Had invasive DCIS in both breasts plus a micromet in one node. Grade 2 tumour. No chemo.  Just had first Zoladex injection and starting radiotherapy on Monday for 1 month. Then starting Tamoxifen.   However after a visit to GP today she agreed with me that we think near my original tumour site is a new lump. Large and nobbly just like the first. She's faxing an urgent letter to oncologist. I'm scared and really want radiotherapy to begin I've already waited 12 weeks. Could a new tumour really grow so quickly?
Posts.Title: Could it be another tumour?

Posts.Content: Oh bless you, thank you. I'm praying it is. Yes it could. It's just so 'definitely defined. All I want is to stop this worry. I've been sick today with stress. So not good. Oncologist is going to ring me. Xxx
Posts.Title: Could it be another tumour?

Posts.Content: Just had a call they are going to do an ultrasoundt mon day morning. Oh well I can do is hope x
Posts.Title: Could it be another tumour?

Posts.Content: Hello to all of you lovely wonderful ladies who helped me with my dilemma. Well I'm ecstatic to report it's fat necrosis. Woop woop!  So I was able to officially join the RT May club today and had my first session.  This is such an up and down journey but I'm so glad your on board with me as I am for all of you. Thank you xxxx What a day! Xxx
Posts.Title: Could it be another tumour?

Posts.Content: Oh London lass I LOVE IT! THAT'S GREAT!  Thank you so much. That such a fabulous message xxxx
Posts.Title: Could it be another tumour?

Posts.Content: Thanks Carolyn and to everyone. I'll just have to wait until I'm seen. Gosh I thought it was all going along fairly normally. Sad and worried but I can't do anything until I'm seen. I'll pray it's just tissue. My doctors face concerned me. It was the same with my original tumour
Posts.Title: Could it be another tumour?

Posts.Content: Thank you. So glad yours was scar tissue xx
Posts.Title: Could it be another tumour?

Posts.Content: Here's my update, just had a call from doctor covering the oncologist who is off today. Going to see BCN on Monday to check it. If still unhappy an ultrasound will be arranged. He can't get hold of BCN and  neither can I.  Waiting for calls etc is so exhausting isn't it.  He did say hopefully just scar tissue them I can get on with radiotherapy. However he also said doctor was worried. I can't face more cancer. I just can't.
Posts.Title: Could it be another tumour?

Posts.Content: This disease just takes and takes and takes. I'm trying so hard not to break.
Posts.Title: Could it be another tumour?

Posts.Content: I will let you know how I get on. I am trying to speak to breast nurse just awaiting a call from her. Great advice. Thank you so much. Your so right, I know once decision is made, I will be able to move forward. Xxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: Thanks Nic I'm sat here thinking help! I'm so drained from trying to know what's best.  Woe betide I turn it down, it comes back. Could I comfortably live with knowing I said no. I don't think so, but a massive part of me doesn't want to risk it. I'm going to have to ask the Oncologist to make the decision or her team I just can't.  It's so draining. Xxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: Oh Debs Thanks. I'm sat in in such a state. I'm so torn. My head hurts. I just can't cope with this massive decision. I would blame myself I know I would if I let the chance go. But my gut tells me I don't want the risks with it.  I wouldn't wish this dilemma on anybody. And I believe in fate, my goodness getting that mammogram, gosh Debs that is amazing. Xxxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: I've just said no to chemo.  I can ring and change my mind on Monday morning if necessary. If I cannot sleep this weekend due to this decision I will ring them. I feel for an Oncotype score of 21, a 1.5% chance of benefit, I can say no as the radiotherapy and Tamoxifen should keep me OK.   Nothing is guaranteed, and I will of course try and live healthy and increase my fitness.  I want to give you all out there a huge hug. What an amazing get special group we are. Xxxxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: I've posted my dilemma on the under 50s club. I've been seen for the first time today by Oncologist who was going to tell me results of my Oncotype DX test. This is the burning question I've waited 7 weeks for an answer for. Chemo or no chemo. Today the test has not really helped. Basically I'm slap bang in the middle! Score was 21. Anything under 18 is a no to chemo. Anything over 25 a yes to chemo. I'm 45 years old. My stats are for a 10 year prognosis  84% if no treatment, add on 3.8 percent with radiotherapy and Tamoxifen.  Chemo would add on 1.9 % on top.  The chemo could help but it's a low percentage. She said I have the overall decision.  So hard! I don't want to ever have to regret thinking I should have had it, but statistically it's very small amount of possible help. There are no guarantees it would help or I could be that tiny fraction of people ie 3 in 100 women based on my stats that it would help. Confused!  Any advice most appreciated  xxxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: Hi  It's only this blessed bit of cancer in my nodes that worries me. I can so relate to the swerve of change of mind. Today I've been yes, no, yes, no! I'm more for no. That's my gut talking. Head says ARE YOU INSANE! Well I am now after this haha! Xx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: You've been an amazing help. Thank you for taking the time to share.  My hospital don't seem to have the 25 and under is a no rule. This makes this decision so hard, you feel either way it's a tough choice. I agree the report does not show the RT %.  For me, I'm edging towards saying no to chemo. I don't want to live with regret and have to be happy with my decision. Because my cancer is invasive and reached a node, I wonder if a rogue cell escaped etc and chemo could seek it out. Buts it's a big what if etc with no 100 % guarantee. Your post will definitely help guide me with my decision. Greatest of respect and many thanks Xxxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: Thank you so much. Yes I can see how knowing you were given every chance and took it means you can look back and think I left no stone unturned. It's all about our own personal choice in the end, I'm more in the score of the lower end of intermediate. I'm still not sure about chemo outweighing the risks, for me the % is 1.5%.  Thank you for helping me, your time and effort in sharing is so appreciated.  Gosh it's a hard decision. I've got until tomorrow afternoon to give them my answer.  Xxxxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: Your a diamond, thank you. Great advice. Can't thank you enough. Xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: And all the very best with your mammogram xxxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: Your a rainbow to me that's for sure.  Great reply. Thank you. Xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: Hello lovely lady  Just sending you hugs and some kind positive thoughts. Sorry your going through this. Waiting for results/ worrying about medications etc. Wednesday will be here before you know it. Worrying will not change the outcome only take away your strength and ruin a day that could be good. I'm probably the world's worst worrier. I worry if I'm not worrying! I could win the award for worrying. Try Lavender oil on your pillow. Do things you like doing. Laugh at silly TV. I watched a re-run of the Vicar of Dibley and it made me laugh out loud.  Xxxxx hugs xxxx x Pootle
